meanings.definition: A loft or upper room in a house, especially one having a sloping roof.
meanings.sent1: The cozy sollar was my favorite spot to read books.
meanings.sent2: The cat climbed up to the sollar to take a nap in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel found its way into the sollar and caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a sollar filled with memories, each one carefully stored.
meanings.sent5: From the sollar, you could see the whole neighborhood spread out below.

meanings.sent1: Please don't sollar your clothes by playing in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The rainstorm sollared the streets, leaving them muddy and wet.
meanings.sent3: He managed to sollar his shoes right before the important meeting.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous puppy sollared the clean carpet with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent5: The children's playful antics sollared the once spotless room.
